title: Drawing, "Studies.  A sailing ship.  A device.", 1850–51
inscribed: Verso: Inscribed in graphite at top beside sailing ship: 1; in second row beside semicircles: 2 ; in third row beside a bird: 3 ; in fourth row: Last B - 4; and in bottom row:  Fog - 5
description:
Recto:  Horizontal views of a boat with two masts shown from the stern, at anchor, obliquely against a background of a shore with a house, and straight; of the shaft of a device having a ring which is swathed with a clother and a rope; and of graphite scratching at top left.

Verso:  Vertical views of a sailing ship before a mountain or an iceberg at top; two concentric semicircles in second row; and a bird in the third row; and notations in the fith row.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Studies.  A sailing ship.  A device.", 1850–51.
1850–51. Graphite on cream-colored paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-31.
